editorialNote.content: * These regulations were made under the repealed sections 29 and 60 of the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281, 1974 R. Ed.)—see section 119(1) of the Merchant Shipping Ordinance (Cap. 281) and section 123(3) of the Merchant Shipping (Safety) Ordinance (Cap. 369).

section.name: s1
section.heading: Citation
section.content: These regulations may be cited as the Merchant Shipping (Court of Survey) Regulations.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Filing of notice of appeal
section.content: Where the owner or master of a ship, hereinafter called the appellant, desires to appeal to the court of survey, he shall file with the Director of Marine a notice in the form of Form 1 in the First Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Proceedings for constituting court
section.content: Immediately on the filing of the notice of appeal the Director shall inform the Chief Executive, and if the ship is a ship not registered in Hong Kong the Director shall give notice to the consular officer for the state to which the ship belongs and such consular officer may nominate one person to act as a member of the court of survey whose name shall be submitted to the Chief Executive at the same time.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Summoning of court
section.content: When the Chief Executive has issued his warrant constituting the court, the person appointed to be the president of the court, hereinafter referred to as the president, shall summon the court in the form of Form 2 in the First Schedule.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Notice to complainant of hearing
section.content: If the survey has been made on the complaint of any person, hereinafter called the complainant, the president shall send to him notice of the time and place appointed for the hearing.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Forwarding copy of report
section.content: Previous to the hearing the Chief Executive shall forward to the president, to be produced as evidence at the hearing, an official copy of the report of the surveyor.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Time of hearing
section.content: The court shall if practicable be summoned to hear the appeal on a day not later than fourteen days from the filing of the notice of appeal.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Parties to proceedings
section.content: The Chief Executive and the appellant shall be parties to the proceedings.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Parties by permission
section.content: Any other person may by permission of the president of the court be made a party to the proceedings.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Calling of witness by Chief Executive’s representative
section.content: At the hearing the person representing the Chief Executive shall first call his witnesses and, having done so, shall state in writing what order he requires the court to make.

section.name: s11
section.heading: Calling of witness by complainant
section.content: The complainant, if he has appeared, shall then call his witnesses and, having done so, shall state in writing what order he requires the court to make.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Calling of witness by appellant
section.content: The appellant shall then call his witnesses and, having done so, shall state in writing what order he requires the court to make.

section.name: s13
section.heading: Witnesses in reply
section.content: After the appellant has examined all his witnesses, the person representing the Chief Executive and the complainant may, on cause shown to the satisfaction of the court, call further witnesses in reply.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Addresses of parties
section.content: After all the witnesses have been examined, the court shall first hear the appellant, then the complainant (if any), and afterwards the person representing the Chief Executive.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Adjournment
section.content: The president may adjourn the court from time to time and from place to place as may be most convenient.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Delivery of decision
section.content: The president shall deliver the decision of the court in writing and the same may be sent or delivered to the respective parties, and it shall not be necessary to hold a court merely for the purpose of giving the decision.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Release or detention of vessel and report
section.content: As soon as possible after the court has come to its decision the court shall issue an order for the release or detention (either finally or on condition) of the vessel, in the form of Form 3 in the First Schedule and the president shall report to the Chief Executive in the form of Form 4 in the First Schedule.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Forms
section.content: The forms in the First Schedule are prescribed for use under these regulations.

section.name: s19
section.heading: Fees
section.content: The appropriate fees prescribed in the Merchant Shipping (Fees) Regulations (Cap. 281 sub. leg. F) shall be payable in respect of any proceedings before a court of survey.
